name: rumex orbiculatus
description:
Great Waterdock is a plant of soils that are quite wet.  The long wide leaves are distinctive as are the brown seed heads that form late in the summer.  Great Waterdock does best in full sun situations.
Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Fall (October) or Spring (April/May).
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
